text: "Thought fitted thought; opinion met opinion: we coincided, in short, and I will attach myself for life to Diana and Mary to-morrow," I said; "so don't consider me an equivalent for one."

passages.fragment: Thought fitted thought ; opinion met opinion : we coincided , in short ,
passages.full_quote: <used>Thought fitted thought; opinion met opinion: we coincided, in short, p</used>erfectly
said I, "tell him to stash his tomahawk there, or pipe, or whatever you call it; tell him to stop smoking, <used>in short, and I will</used> turn in with him"

passages.fragment: , and I will attach myself for life to Diana and Mary
passages.full_quote: I like Moor House, and I will live at Moor House; I like Diana and Mary<used>, and I will attach myself for life to Diana and Mary</used>

passages.fragment: to Diana and Mary to-morrow , '' I said
passages.full_quote: "Write <used>to Diana and Mary to-morrow," I said</used>, "and tell them to come home directly"

passages.fragment: , '' I said ; `` so do n't consider me an equivalent for one
passages.full_quote: "I'll not stand you an inch in the stead of a seragl<used>io," I said; "so don't consider me an equivalent for one</used>"
